content.text: is designed to process billing records that span multiple billing periods. It takes spanned billing records, splits them into individual billing periods, and calculates the appropriate billing amounts and usage for each period. The procedure then inserts these calculated values into a summary table for further processing or reporting.
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to several factors:
It involves multiple steps, including data insertion, cursor-based iteration, and complex calculations.
It uses several custom functions and procedures to calculate billing percentages and dates.
The procedure handles multiple variables and calculations to ensure accurate distribution of billing amounts across periods.
It involves conditional logic to handle different scenarios for date determination and percentage application.
: Represents the billing period in 'YYYYMM' format.
: The ID of the authenticated user executing the procedure.
: The unique identifier for the utility company.
: An output parameter used to indicate the status of the procedure execution (0 for success, 9 for initial setup).
: Sets the initial status to 9 and declares various variables for processing.
A cursor is declared to iterate over records in
For each record, it retrieves necessary details and calculates the total spanned billed percentage.
For each spanned record, it calculates the billing amounts and usage for each period using a loop.
It applies a monthly percentage to distribute the amounts and usage.
After processing n-1 periods, it calculates the remaining amounts for the last period.
Inserts the final period's data into the summary table.
: Closes and deallocates the cursor after processing all records.
: Sets the status to 0 to indicate successful completion.
: The use of a cursor can lead to performance issues, especially with large datasets, as it processes records row-by-row.
: The procedure involves multiple calculations and function calls, which can be resource-intensive.
: Frequent inserts into the summary table can cause I/O overhead, especially if the table is large or heavily indexed.
: The cursor-based approach may not scale well with large datasets, potentially leading to slow performance.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling, which could lead to unhandled exceptions or incorrect status updates.
: The reliance on external functions for date calculations could introduce errors if those functions are not robust or if they fail to handle edge cases.
: The procedure attempts to mitigate rounding errors, but there is still a risk of inaccuracies in financial calculations.
: If multiple instances of this procedure run simultaneously, there could be contention issues, especially with shared resources like tables or functions.

CREATE PROCEDURE [ManualBill].[usp_ManualBilling_ProcessAccountSpanned]
	@BillingPeriod varchar(6),
	@authenticatedID int,
	@utilityCompany dbo.seqid,
	@Status int  OUTPUT      
   
 AS 
 begin
 
	 --********************************************************************************
	 --	Author: MOHAMMED BELARREM
	 -- Description: Slice and dice the spanned bills to individual periods 
	 --				 
	 --
	 --	Log: 
	 --		Creation 02/10/2009
	 --		Update   06/15/2009	Updated the @CalculatedFromDate = @CalculatedToDate after each iteration
	 --		Update   12/28/2009 Updated the tables and needed to reflect the changes
	 --		Update	 01/07/2010 Updated the queries to be invoice Billing Group independant
	 --		Update   01/13/2010 Updated the tables and added the accountseqid
	 --		Update   12/17/2010 Updated the pasrsing initial load query to join by accountseqid
	 --							since some of the utilities recylce accounts.
	 --							central hudson accounts caused a bug because 2 of the accounts when they recycled the acccounts and the previous number was 
	 --							bimonthly so the query picked up B as cycle and produced wrong results 
	 --     Update   12/17/2018 VY update for UniqueAccountSeqID
	 --******************************************************************************** 
	
 
 
 
	/*****************************************************
	Declarations
	******************************************************/
	-- cursor
	declare @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid dbo.seqid
	
	-- spanned record information
	declare @IBGSeqid						dbo.seqid	
	declare @AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid dbo.seqid	
    declare @AccountSeqid					dbo.seqid
	declare @OriginalAccountNumber			dbo.acctnum			
	declare @BillingPeriodRevision			dbo.yyyymm			
	declare @FirstBillingPeriodCanceled		dbo.yyyymm						
	declare @DeltaNumberOfPeriods			dbo.Accumulator			
	declare @FromDate						dbo.yyyymmdd						
	declare @ToDate							dbo.yyyymmdd		
	declare @BillingPeriodDays				dbo.BillingPeriodDays			
	declare @NetBilledAmount				dbo.BillingAmt			
	declare @EnergySource					dbo.EnergySource			
	declare @EnergyUsage					dbo.EnergyUnit			
	declare @DemandUsage					dbo.Kilowatts			
	declare @BillingCycle					dbo.MonthlyBillingCycle	
	declare @TripNumber						dbo.TripNumber
		
	declare @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne			int
	declare @TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage	dbo.DiscountPercentage
	declare @ApplyMonthlyPercentage				dbo.DiscountPercentage
	
	declare @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision	dbo.yyyymm
	declare @CalculatedFromDate					dbo.yyyymmdd
	declare @CalculatedToDate					dbo.yyyymmdd
	declare @idx								int
	declare @NetBilledAmountMonthlySum			dbo.BillingAmt
	declare @EnergyMonthlySum					dbo.EnergyUnit
	declare @DemandMonthlySum					dbo.Kilowatts
	declare @NetBilledAmountMonthly				dbo.BillingAmt
	declare @EnergyMonthly						dbo.EnergyUnit
	declare @DemandMonthly						dbo.Kilowatts
	declare @NetBilledAmountLastPeriod			dbo.BillingAmt
	declare @EnergyLastPeriod					dbo.EnergyUnit
	declare @DemandLastPeriod					dbo.Kilowatts
	
	declare @Notes	dbo.notes
	
 
	-- setup 
	set @Status = 9 
	
	
	/*********************************
	1. copy spanned bills into UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpanned
	********************************/ 
	INSERT INTO ManualBill.[UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpanned]
           ([title]
           ,[UtilityCompanySeqid]
           ,[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
           ,[AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid]
           ,[AccountSeqid]
		   ,[UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
           ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
           ,[BillingPeriod]
           ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
           ,[FirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
           ,[DeltaNumberOfPeriods]
           ,[FromDate]
           ,[ToDate]
           ,[BillingPeriodDays]
           ,[BillingAction]
           ,[ActualOrEstimated]
           ,[NetBilledAmount]
           ,[EnergyUsage]
           ,[DemandUsage]
           ,[EnergySource])
           
	select 
			'SpannedAccountbilling'			---	[title]
           ,UtilityCompanySeqid				---	[UtilityCompanySeqid]
           ,InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid	---	[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
           ,AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid ---	[AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid]
           ,AccountSeqid					--- [AccountSeqid]
		   ,UniqueAccountSeqid               --- [UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
           ,OriginalAccountNumber			---	[OriginalAccountNumber]
           ,BillingPeriod 					---	[BillingPeriod]
           ,BillingPeriodRevision 			---	[BillingPeriodRevision]
           ,FirstBillingPeriodCanceled 		---	[FirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
           ,DeltaNumberOfPeriods			---	[DeltaNumberOfPeriods]
           ,FromDate 						---	[FromDate]
           ,ToDate 							---	[ToDate]
           ,BillingPeriodDays 				---	[BillingPeriodDays]
           ,BillingAction					--- BillingAction
           ,ActualOrEstimated				--- ActualOrEstimated
           ,NetBilledAmount					---	[NetBilledAmount]
           ,EnergyUsage						---	[EnergyUsage]
           ,DemandUsage						---	[DemandUsage]
           ,EnergySource					---	[EnergySource]
	
	FROM ManualBill.UploadManualBillingAccount
	WHERE ( DeltaNumberOfPeriods > 1 )
 
	/*********************************
	2. Parsed spanned acount info
	********************************/

	--	DECLARE a cursor to find all account bills that span more than one period.
	DECLARE SpannedBillCursor CURSOR FOR
	SELECT UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid FROM ManualBill.UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpanned

	OPEN SpannedBillCursor;

	FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedBillCursor INTO @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid
	--
	-- Check @@FETCH_STATUS to see if there are any more rows to fetch.
	--
	WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0
	BEGIN -- begin processing for fetched record
				
			--
			-- 2.1. Process n-1 spanned periods
			--
	
			select
				 @AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid	= Spanned.AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid
				,@AccountSeqid						= Spanned.AccountSeqid
				,@OriginalAccountNumber				= Spanned.OriginalAccountNumber
				,@BillingPeriodRevision				= Spanned.BillingPeriodRevision
				,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled		= Spanned.FirstBillingPeriodCanceled
				,@DeltaNumberOfPeriods				= Spanned.DeltaNumberOfPeriods
				,@FromDate							= Spanned.FromDate
				,@ToDate							= Spanned.ToDate
				,@BillingPeriodDays					= Spanned.BillingPeriodDays
				,@NetBilledAmount					= Spanned.NetBilledAmount
				,@EnergyUsage						= Spanned.EnergyUsage
				,@DemandUsage						= Spanned.DemandUsage
				,@EnergySource						= Spanned.EnergySource
				,@BillingCycle						= Billing.Account.BillingCycle
				,@TripNumber						= Billing.Account.TripNumber
			from ManualBill.UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpanned as Spanned inner join Billing.Account on
				spanned.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber  AND Billing.Account.AccountSeqid = Spanned.AccountSeqid
			where ( UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid )


			/*
				 Distribute over spanned based on given percentage
			*/

			-- 2.1 periodAggregate the average City wide monthly energy usage percentage for the spanned row billing periods 
			select @TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage =[ManualBill].[CalculateTotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage] (@BillingCycle,@DeltaNumberOfPeriods,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled,@BillingPeriodRevision,@EnergySource )
				
			-- 2.2 Determine the number of periods minus 1 to pro-rate the money and usage.  The last period will derive the money and usage
			--	by row totals - (the n-1 aggregates of money and usage)
			set @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne = @DeltaNumberOfPeriods-1


			--
			--	2.3 Initialize the counters for the n-1 parses
			--
			set @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = @FirstBillingPeriodCanceled 
			set @CalculatedFromDate				 = @FromDate 
			set @CalculatedToDate				 = @ToDate 
			set @idx							 = 0 
			set @NetBilledAmountMonthlySum		 = 0.00 
			set @EnergyMonthlySum				 = 0.00  
			set @DemandMonthlySum				 = 0  
			--
			
			--- 2.4 distribute / parse
			while (@NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne > @idx)
			Begin 

				-- 2.4.1 set value for required variables

				-- The @ApplyMonthlyPercentage holds the weigthed average for the particular month
				select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [ManualBill].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageXXXSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage, @EnergySource)

				--				
				-- Apply the Monthly Percentage to the CCF,Therms and Billed Amount 
				--
				set @NetBilledAmountMonthly	= ROUND(@NetBilledAmount * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
				set @EnergyMonthly			= ROUND(@EnergyUsage * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,0)
				set @DemandMonthly			= ROUND(@DemandUsage * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
				
				--
				-- Accululate the weigthed average units.
				--
				set @NetBilledAmountMonthlySum = @NetBilledAmountMonthlySum + @NetBilledAmountMonthly
				set @EnergyMonthlySum		= @EnergyMonthlySum + @EnergyMonthly
				set @DemandMonthlySum		= @DemandMonthlySum + @DemandMonthly
		
				
				--  
				--	The Billing Period Projected "ToDate" is derived from the table "dbo.BillingPeriodProjected" using the utility company seqid and the
				--	RevisedBillingPeriod and using the "EndofPeriodTodate" as the derived "Todate" for the account.
				--
				select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.DeterminActualDate(@OriginalAccountNumber, 'T', @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, @BillingCycle)

				if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
					select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.DetermineProjectedToOrFromDate(@utilityCompany, @IBGSeqid, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 'T', @tripNumber, @BillingCycle ) 
					-- if both above methods fail prorate
				if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
					select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.ProRateToOrFromDate('T', @BillingCycle, @FromDate, @ToDate, @idx, @DeltaNumberOfPeriods  )
				

				-- 2.4.2	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
				--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
				select @Notes = SUBSTRING( cast(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods as varchar(6))+ ' First: '+@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@FromDate+') Last: '+ 
				@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@ToDate+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+cast(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(10))+
				' - Total %: '+cast(@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(10)), 1, 300)

				--
				-- 2.4.3  INSERT the data into the summary table
				--		
				INSERT INTO ManualBill.[UploadManualBillingAccountSummary]
					   ([UtilityCompanySeqid]
					   ,[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
					   ,[AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid]
					   ,[AccountSeqid]
					   ,[UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
					   ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
					   ,[NumberOfTransactions]
					   ,[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
					   ,[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
					   ,[BillingPeriod]
					   ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
					   ,[BillingAction]
					   ,[ActualOrEstimated]
					   ,[FromDate]
					   ,[ToDate]
					   ,[BillingPeriodDays]
					   ,[NetBilledAmount]
					   ,[EnergyUsage]
					   ,[DemandUsage]
					   ,[EnergySource]
					   ,[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
					   ,[SpannedFromDate]
					   ,[SpannedToDate]
					   ,[SpannedBillingPeriodDays]
					   ,[SpannedBillingPeriodRevision]
					   ,[SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
					   ,[SpannedNetBilledAmount]
					   ,[SpannedEnergyUsage]
					   ,[SpannedDemandUsage]
					   ,[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
					   ,[SpannedTotalPercentage]
					   ,[Notes]
					   ,[AuthenticatedUserID]
					   ,[DateAdded]
					   ,[LastUpdate])
				
				select 	
						@utilityCompany							--[UtilityCompanySeqid]
					   ,InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid			--[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
					   ,AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid			--[AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid]
					   ,AccountSeqid							--[AccountSeqid] 
					   ,UniqueAccountSeqID                      --[UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
					   ,OriginalAccountNumber					--[OriginalAccountNumber]
					   ,1										--[NumberOfTransactions]
					   ,1										--[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
					   ,0										--[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
					   ,BillingPeriod							--[BillingPeriod]
					   ,@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision		--[BillingPeriodRevision]
					   ,CASE WHEN @BillingPeriod = @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision THEN 'O' ELSE 'A' END	--[BillingAction]
					   ,'EST'									--[ActualOrEstimated]
					   ,@CalculatedFromDate						--[FromDate]
					   ,@CalculatedToDate						--[ToDate]
					   ,dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate, @CalculatedToDate)			--[BillingDays]
					   ,@NetBilledAmountMonthly					--[NetBilledAmount]
					   ,isnull(@EnergyMonthly, 0)				--[EnergyUsage]
					   ,@DemandMonthly							--[DemandUsage]
					   ,@EnergySource							--[EnergySource]
					   ,'Y'										--[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
					   ,@FromDate								--[SpannedFromDate]
					   ,@ToDate									--[SpannedToDate]
					   ,@BillingPeriodDays						--[SpannedBillingDays]
					   ,@BillingPeriodRevision					--[SpannedBillingPeriodRevision]
					   ,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled				--[SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
					   ,@NetBilledAmount						--[SpannedNetBilledAmount]
					   ,@EnergyUsage							--[SpannedEnergy]
					   ,@DemandUsage							--[SpannedDemand]
					   ,@ApplyMonthlyPercentage					--[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
					   ,@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage		--[SpannedTotalPercentage]
					   ,@Notes									--[Notes]
					   ,@authenticatedID						--[AuthenticatedUserID]
					   ,getdate()								--[DateAdded]
					   ,getdate()								--[LastUpdate]
		 		from ManualBill.UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpanned 
				where ( UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid )
															
					
					
					 					 
					--
					--	Calculate the next Revised Billing Period row.
					select @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = [dbo].[CalculateNextBillingPeriod]  (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@BillingCycle)
					--	This will derive the new Revised Billing Period row's "FromDate"
					
					
					-- commented by MOH on 06/15/2009
					-- *********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************
					set @CalculatedFromDate = @CalculatedToDate
					--select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.DeterminActualDate(@OriginalAccountNumber, 'T', @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, @BillingCycle)
					--
					--if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
					--	select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.DetermineProjectedToOrFromDate(@utilityCompany, @IBGSeqid, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 'T', @tripNumber, @BillingCycle	) 
					--
					--	-- if both above methods fail prorate
					--if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
					--	select @CalculatedToDate = ManualBill.ProRateToOrFromDate('T', @BillingCycle, @FromDate, @ToDate, @idx, @DeltaNumberOfPeriods  )
					-- *********************************************************************************************************************************************************************************



				set @idx = @idx + 1
			end -- end distribute/parse

		--
		-- 2.2. Process the last spanned period
		--
	
		select @CalculatedFromDate = ManualBill.DeterminActualDate(@OriginalAccountNumber, 'F', @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, @BillingCycle)

		if(@CalculatedFromDate is null)
			select @CalculatedFromDate = ManualBill.DetermineProjectedToOrFromDate(@utilityCompany, @IBGSeqid, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 'F', @tripNumber, @BillingCycle	) 

			-- if both above methods fail prorate
		if(@CalculatedFromDate is null)
			select @CalculatedFromDate = ManualBill.ProRateToOrFromDate('F', @BillingCycle, @FromDate, @ToDate, @idx, @DeltaNumberOfPeriods  )
		
		--
		select @CalculatedToDate = @ToDate
		--
		--	@ApplyMonthlyPercentage is used for the notes purposes only
		--
		select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [ManualBill].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageXXXSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage, @EnergySource)
		
		
		/*debugger*/
		select 'value of @ApplyMonthlyPercentage is: ' + cast( @TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(15)) AS 	TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage	
		select 'value of @ApplyMonthlyPercentage is: ' + cast( @ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(15)) AS 	ApplyMonthlyPercentageis	

		
		--
		--	Derive the net changes to avoid rounding errors
		--
		set @NetBilledAmountLastPeriod	= @NetBilledAmount - @NetBilledAmountMonthlySum
		set @EnergyLastPeriod			= @EnergyUsage  - @EnergyMonthlySum
		set @DemandLastPeriod			= @DemandUsage  - @DemandMonthlySum

		--
		--	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
		--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
		--
		select @Notes = SUBSTRING(cast(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods as varchar(6))+' First: '+@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@FromDate+') Last: '+ 
		@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@ToDate+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+cast(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(10))+
		' - Total %: '+cast(@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(10)), 1, 300)	




		/******************************************************************************************************
			Insert the last period 
		*******************************************************************************************************/


		INSERT INTO [ManualBill].[UploadManualBillingAccountSummary]
				   ([UtilityCompanySeqid]
				   ,[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
				   ,[AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid]
				   ,[AccountSeqid]
				   ,[UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
				   ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
				   ,[NumberOfTransactions]
				   ,[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
				   ,[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
				   ,[BillingPeriod]
				   ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
				   ,[BillingAction]
				   ,[ActualOrEstimated]
				   ,[FromDate]
				   ,[ToDate]
				   ,[BillingPeriodDays]
				   ,[NetBilledAmount]
				   ,[EnergyUsage]
				   ,[DemandUsage]
				   ,[EnergySource]
				   ,[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
				   ,[SpannedFromDate]
				   ,[SpannedToDate]
				   ,[SpannedBillingPeriodDays]
				   ,[SpannedBillingPeriodRevision]
				   ,[SpannedFirstBillingPeriodCanceled]
				   ,[SpannedNetBilledAmount]
				   ,[SpannedEnergyUsage]
				   ,[SpannedDemandUsage]
				   ,[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
				   ,[SpannedTotalPercentage]
				   ,[Notes]
				   ,[AuthenticatedUserID]
				   ,[DateAdded]
				   ,[LastUpdate])


			select 	
					@utilityCompany							--[UtilityCompanySeqid]
				   ,InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid			--[InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid]
				   ,AccountmanualBillingHeaderSeqid			--[AccountManualBillingHeaderSeqid]
				   ,AccountSeqid							--[Accountseqid]
				   ,UniqueAccountSeqid                      --[UniqueAccountSeqid] /* added on 12/17/2018 */
				   ,OriginalAccountNumber					--[OriginalAccountNumber]
				   ,1										--[NumberOfTransactions]
				   ,1										--[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
				   ,0										--[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
				   ,BillingPeriod							--[BillingPeriod]
				   ,@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision		--[BillingPeriodRevision]
				   ,CASE WHEN @BillingPeriod = @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision THEN 'O' ELSE 'A' END		--[BillingAction]
				   ,'EST'									--[ActualOrEstimated]
				   ,@CalculatedFromDate						--[FromDate]
				   ,@CalculatedToDate						--[ToDate]
				   ,dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(@CalculatedFromDate, @CalculatedToDate)				--[BillingPeriodDays]
				   ,@NetBilledAmountLastPeriod				--[NetBilledAmount]
				   ,isnull(@EnergyLastPeriod, 0)			--[EnergyUsage]
				   ,@DemandLastPeriod						--[DemandUsage]
				   ,@EnergySource							--[EnergySource]
				   ,'Y'										--[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
				   ,@FromDate								--[SpannedFromDate]
				   ,@ToDate									--[SpannedToDate]
				   ,@BillingPeriodDays						--[SpannedBillingDays]
				   ,@BillingPeriodRevision					--[SpannedBillingPeriodRevision]
				   ,@FirstBillingPeriodCanceled				--[SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod]
				   ,@NetBilledAmount						--[SpannedNetBilledAmount]
				   ,@EnergyUsage							--[SpannedEnergy]
				   ,@DemandUsage							--[SpannedDemand]
				   ,@ApplyMonthlyPercentage					--[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
				   ,@TotalXXXSpannedBilledPercentage		--[SpannedTotalPercentage]
				   ,@Notes									--[Notes]
				   ,@authenticatedID						--[AuthenticatedUserID]
				   ,getdate()								--[DateAdded]
				   ,getdate()								--[LastUpdate]
	 		from ManualBill.UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpanned 
			where ( UploadManualBillingAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid )
														
		

 
			--	Process the next row
			--
			FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedBillCursor INTO @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid
	End -- end processing for fetched record

	CLOSE SpannedBillCursor; -- close cursor
	DEALLOCATE SpannedBillCursor;
	
	
	set @Status = 0

 
 end
